sections.text: Short TitleSection 75-89-3 - DefinitionsSection 75-89-5 - Commodity sale or purchase permitted only pursuant to Section 75-89-7 or 75-89-9Section 75-89-7 - Persons authorized to conduct commodity transactionsSection 75-89-9 - Exempt transactions; qualified seller defined; requirements; waiver of requirements; authority of administrator to deny, suspend, revoke or place limitations on authority of, or exemption for, qualified seller; summary denial or suspension of exemption for qualified seller; rules, regulations and ordersSection 75-89-11 - Requirements to engage in trade or business of commodity merchantSection 75-89-13 - Fraudulent or deceitful acts, false or misleading statements or reports, and the like prohibitedSection 75-89-15 - Vicarious or agency liabilitySection 75-89-17 - Purpose and construction; no private rights or remedies createdSection 75-89-19 - Investigation and enforcement by administrator; compulsion of testimony and other evidenceSection 75-89-21 - Action by administrator to prevent, enjoin, and prosecute violations; administrative penaltiesSection 75-89-23 - Judicial measures to prevent, enjoin, and prosecute violations of Mississippi or other state's Commodity Act; special remedies; administrator need not post bondSection 75-89-25 - Penalties; period of limitations; institution of criminal proceedingsSection 75-89-27 - Secretary of State to administer chapter; insider information; public and privileged information; subpoena of evidenceSection 75-89-29 - Cooperation with like agencies in other jurisdictionsSection 75-89-31 - Administrator may make, amend and rescind rules, forms and orders; publication of same; exemption from liability thereforSection 75-89-33 - Conduct violative of chapter or rule deemed appointment of administrator to accept service of processSection 75-89-35 - Applicability of certain provisions when purchase, sale, or offer to buy or sell is made in state; what constitutes purchase, sale, or offer to buy or sell in stateSection 75-89-37 - Procedure for administrative proceedings; notice and hearingSection 75-89-39 - Judicial review of final ordersSection 75-89-41 - Burden of proof as to exemptionsSection 75-89-43 - Failure to make timely delivery not a violation when caused by factors beyond control of seller, seller's agents, etcSection 75-89-45 - Interpretative opinions; no-action determinations
